cn.edu.uestc.acmicpc.db.condition.base

Class BaseCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • cn.edu.uestc.acmicpc.db.condition.base.BaseCondition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContestCondition, ProblemCondition, StatusCondition, UserCondition

    public abstract class BaseCondition
extends Object
implements org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware
    We can use this class to transform conditions to database's Criterion list

    USAGE

    We can write a simple class than extends this class, and add the Exp annotation to each getter of the class. If we do not do with, the field will be passed into invoke() method.

    For developer:

    • In default, the class field's name is equal to the data field's name. If you want to map the class field into another data field, use the MapField parameter please.

      For example:

      @Exp(MapField = "userId", Type = ConditionType.eq)
      public Integer getId();

    • If the field is other class's key field, please use the MapObject parameter.

      For example:

      @Exp(Type = ConditionType.eq, MapObject = Department.class)
      public Integer getDepartmentId;

    • ConditionType.like type will add % in two ends of the string, otherwise rewrite the invoke method to deal with it.

      For example:

      public String getUserName;
      @Override
      public void invoke(ArrayList conditions) {
        if (userName != null)
          conditions.add(Restrictions.like("userName", "%" + userName"));
      }

    Author:
    fish
